name: Nattokinase
description: Fibrinolytic enzyme derived from natto (fermented soybeans). Dissolves fibrin clots, reduces blood viscosity, and supports cardiovascular health. Used widely in Japan for decades. Emerging evidence for reducing spike protein and microclot concerns.

dosage.notes: Take on empty stomach (away from food). Measured in fibrinolytic units (FU). NSK-SD form is vitamin K2-free for those on blood thinners.

keyFindings: Reduced blood pressure in hypertensive subjects (meta-analysis)
Significant fibrinolytic activity demonstrated in human trials
Reduced blood viscosity and improved flow in clinical studies
interactions: Blood thinners (warfarin, aspirin) â€” significant interaction
